858.001 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Golf cart" shall mean an open, four-wheeled, doorless motor vehicle
with no more than eight seats, with an attainable speed in one mile on a paved
level surface of more than 20 miles per hour but not more than twenty-five
miles per hour and with a gross vehicle weight rating less than 3,000 pounds.
For purposes of
Chapter 858, "golf cart" shall also include under-speed and low-speed vehicles
as defined in Section 490.01 of the Codified Ordinances.
   (b)   "Person, firm, or corporation" includes any person, firm or
corporation engaging in business activity described in this chapter on South
Bass Island.
(Ord. 1430-24. Passed 3-12-24; Ord. 1440-24. Passed 5-14-24.)
858.01 LICENSE FEES; DEPOSIT INTO PUBLIC SERVICE STREET REPAIR FUND.
   (a)   Owners of vehicles used for the transportation of persons or property,
for hire and for use within the Village, shall pay by April 15 of each year, an
annual, nontransferable vehicle license fee for each vehicle as follows:
      (1)   Buses and/or trolleys and/or self-powered $500.00
      (2)   Tour train cars and/or towed tram car/unit$400.00
      (3)   Taxicabs:                                  
         A.   Motor-driven                         $400.00
         B.   Horse-driven                         $400.00
         C.   Pedicab bicycles                     $50.00
      (4)   Bicycles                                  $25.00
      (5)   Motorized bicycle/mopeds                  $75.00
      (6)   Golf carts/under-speed vehicles/low-speed $100.00s
      (7)   Rental motor vehicles/vehicles            $100.00
 
   (b)   In addition to the vehicle license fee above, owners subject to this
section shall also provide the following information, on or before April 15 of
each calendar year, in writing to the Fiscal Officer for each vehicle subject
to division (a) of this section:
      (1)   Vehicle Identification Number;
      (2)   License plate number (if applicable);
      (3)   Proof of registration with the Ohio Bureau of Motor Vehicles if
applicable; and
      (4)   Any other information as may be designated in writing by Council or
the Mayor.
   (c)   All moneys and receipts which are derived from the enforcement of this
section shall be credited and paid into a separate fund, which fund shall be
known as the Public Service Street Repair Fund. All moneys and receipts
credited to such Fund shall be used for the sole purpose of repairing streets,
avenues, alleys and lanes within the Village of Put-in-Bay.
(Ord. 645-95. Passed 12-14-95; Ord. 928-08. Passed 4-7-08; Ord. 1007-11. Passed
4-11-11; Ord. 1039-11. Passed 5-14-12.)
   (d)   Upon compliance with divisions (a) and (b) of this section, the
Village shall either 1) enter the vehicle's license plate number into a
designated enforcement database; or 2) issue a vehicle registration sticker,
which must be exhibited in a location designated by the Mayor on each bus/
trolley/self powered tram, tour train car and/or towed tram car/unit, taxi cab,
bicycle, motorized bicycle/moped, rental motor vehicle and under-speed vehicle/
low-speed vehicle car at all times.
 
[https://export.amlegal.com/media/b528d94e610740cee232df2dd6102ef4c558f4a5/
IMAGES/0-0-0-29.jpg]
   (e)   In addition to any other penalties imposed by this chapter, the Fiscal
Officer is authorized, directed and empowered to collect all license fees,
charges, and penalties imposed by this chapter which are not paid when due,
and/or to enforce all other provisions of this chapter, by a civil action at
law, or by other appropriate proceedings, in any court of competent
jurisdiction in the name of the Village from any owner of a vehicle used for
the transportation of persons or property for hire, or any other person who is
liable to provide the required information and/or pay the fees, charges, and
penalties imposed by this chapter. If legal action is taken pursuant to this
division (e), the Village shall be entitled to recover the cost of such legal
action from the person responsible, including reasonable attorney fees.
(Ord. 1153-17. Passed 5-15-17; Ord. 1289-21. Passed 11-9-21; Ord. 1405-23.
Passed 6-23-23; Ord. 1424-23. Passed 12-12-23; Ord. 1470-24. Passed 12-10-24;
Ord. 1482-25. Passed 4-8-25.)
858.02   NOTICE OF TRAFFIC LAWS; USE OF SEAT BELTS AND CHILD RESTRAINTS IN GOLF
CARTS.
   (a)   Ohio R.C. 4513.262, which requires the installation of seat belts in
passenger cars, shall apply to golf carts sold, rented, leased or operated
within the Village limits, except that this section shall require a seat belt
for each person on the golf cart.
   (b)   Ohio R.C. 4511.81, which requires the use of child restraints in
vehicles that are required to be equipped with seat belts, shall apply to golf
carts sold, rented, leased or operated within the Village limits.
   (c)   Each person on a golf cart shall be required to fasten the seat belt.
   (d)   The operator of a golf cart shall comply with child restraint
requirements of Ohio R.C. 4511.81, and any other applicable Ohio law or Village
ordinance governing the use of child restraints.
   (e)   Each person, firm, or corporation required to hold a golf cart
business license described in Section 858.03 shall post a sign in legible
lettering, in a conspicuous place within that area of the place of business to
which customers requesting to rent or lease golf carts are directed enter into
such agreement, which sign shall state as follows:
         “NOTICE”
         “Pursuant to Ohio law a golf cart is a motor vehicle, and when
operated on public streets and highways is subject to all traffic laws
governing the operation of a motor vehicle. Golf carts operated on public
streets and highways shall be operated only by persons having a valid driver’s
license.
         Each person on a golf cart is required to wear a fastened seat belt
while the vehicle is in operation and children must be secured in a proper
child restraint.
         “Put-in-Bay Village Ordinance, Section 858.02.”
   (f)   All owners or operators of businesses which rent or lease golf carts
shall comply with the provisions of division (c) of this section by July 11,
1996.
   (g)   Each person, firm, or corporation required to hold a golf cart
business license described in section 858.03, prior to offering any golf cart
for rent or hire shall place a sticker/sign facing the driver seat in the lower
left hand corner of the windshield of each golf cart to be rented or leased
which states as follows:
         “THIS GOLF CART IS A LICENSED MOTOR VEHICLE. ALL OHIO MOTOR VEHICLE
         LAWS APPLY EQUALLY TO AUTOMOBILES AND GOLF CARTS, INCLUDING:
            YOU MUST HAVE A VALID DRIVERS LICENSE TO OPERATE THIS VEHICLE
            NO DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR DRUGS
            NO OPEN CONTAINERS OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES
            DRIVER AND ALL PASSENGERS MUST COMPLY WITH SEATBELT AND
            CHILD RESTRAINT REQUIREMENTS”
   (h)   Each person, firm, or corporation required to hold a golf cart
business license described in Section 858.03, prior to offering any golf cart
for rent or hire, shall place a business sign on each golf cart. The sign
shall:
      (1)   Be prominently displayed on the front hood or side of the golf
cart;
      (2)   Be permanently affixed;
      (3)   Be unobstructed and be no less than [12 inches in length and 12
inches in height]; and
      (4)   Contain the business' name and phone number.
   (i)   The requirements found in (g) and (h) of this section shall also apply
to any golf cart registered pursuant to Section 858.01.
   (j)   For the purposes of this chapter, any golf cart operated on the public
roadway or using public parking that meets the sign requirements in (h) of this
section shall be considered a vehicle used for the transportation of persons or
property, for hire and for use within the Village, if the vehicle owner is in
the business of renting golf carts.
   (k)   A business license shall not be issued to any business which does not
comply with this section.
(Ord. 659-96. Passed 6-13-96; Ord. 1007-11. Passed 4-11-11; Ord. 1039-12.
Passed 5-14-12; Ord. 1042-12. Passed 6-11-12; Ord. 1482-25. Passed 4-8-25.)
 858.03 LICENSING OF BUSINESSES ENGAGED IN RENTALS.
   (a)   No person, firm, or corporation shall offer for rent or for hire any
golf-cart that may be used on public Village roadways unless the owner of the
vehicle has obtained a business license pursuant to Section 802.09 of the
Village's Codified Ordinances and, pursuant to Section
858.01, paid a vehicle license fee in accordance with section 858.01 from the
Village for each vehicle prior to operation. Said business license shall be
known as a golf cart business license.
   (b)   No person, firm, or corporation shall offer for rent or hire any
vehicle, including without limitation golf carts, for which a vehicle license
does not exist under Section
858.01.
   (c)   A person, firm, or corporation who holds a golf cart business license
may not operate in the same physical location that is used by any person, firm
or corporation who holds a separate golf cart business license and uses the
same physical location to operate said licensed business.
   (d)   Notwithstanding division (b) above, no person, firm, or corporation
shall offer for rent or hire any utility terrain vehicle (UTV), all-terrain
vehicle (ATV) or side by side for operation on public roadways.
   (e)   Golf cart business licenses shall also be subject to
Chapter 802, Sections
802.011,
802.02,
802.021,
802.03,
802.031,
802.04,
802.06,
802.07,
802.11, and
802.12.
(Ord. 1430-24. Passed 3-12-24; Ord. 1440-24. Passed 5-14-24.)
 858.04 POWERS OF COUNCIL.
   (a)   Beginning in January 2025, the Council shall, at least once every
three years, conduct a public hearing to determine the total number of golf
cart business licenses that should be available, the total number of golf carts
available for rent or for hire within the Village, and the total number of golf
carts that each golf cart business license holder may hold a vehicle license
fee for and have available for rent or for hire. The Council's determination
made pursuant to this section shall be based upon the following factors:
      (1)   Public demand for golf-cart lease or rental;
      (2)   Whether the public has been adequately served by the existing
current number of golf carts available for rent;
      (3)   South Bass Island area population and statistics, including tourist
population;
      (4)   The effect on traffic congestion and the safety of existing
vehicular and pedestrian traffic; and
      (5)   Such other factors as the Council finds to be relevant.
   (b)   The Council shall make its determination of the total num her of golf
cart business licenses, the total number of golf carts available for rent or
for hire within the Village, and the total number of golf carts that each golf
cart business license holder may hold a vehicle license fee for and have
available for rent or for hire no later than March 15 of each year, and shall
review such determinations at least every third year thereafter, or more
frequently as Council may determine is prudent.
(Ord. 1430-24. Passed 3-12-24.)
 858.05 APPLICATION AND ISSUANCE OF GOLF CART BUSINESS LICENSE.
   (a)   To obtain a golf cart business license, each person, firm, or
corporation shall submit an application to the Fiscal Officer in accordance
with the rules and regulations adopted pursuant to Section
858.04.
   (b)   Each golf cart business license shall be valid beginning on the date
of. issuance through December 31 of that same year. A golf cart business
license holder may renew their license by submitting a timely renewal
application. Said application will be timely if submitted no later than 30 days
prior to the expiration of the current golf cart business license.
   (c)   The Village shall issue no more than 18 golf cart business licenses.
   (d)   Notwithstanding division (c) above, upon the initial effective date of
this section and for 60 days thereafter, the Village shall issue a golf cart
business license for 2024 upon the application of any person, firm, or
corporation who on March 12, 2024 held a valid golf cart vehicle registration
pursuant to Section
858.01.
(Ord. 1430-24. Passed 3-12-24; Ord. 1440-24. Passed 5-14-24.)
858.06 LIMITATION ON GOLF CART RENTALS.
   In order to maintain the general peace and welfare of the Village and to
prevent severe traffic congestion, the num her of golf carts available to rent
shall be limited as follows:
   (a)   The Village shall issue no more than 865 golf cart vehicle
registrations per calendar year to golf cart business license holders located
in the Village pursuant to Section
858.01. The Village shall issue no more than 865 golf cart vehicle
registrations per calendar year to golf cart business license holders located
in Put-in-Bay Township pursuant to Section
858.01.
   (b)   A person, firm or corporation who, pursuant to Section
858.01, held a vehicle license for any golf cart in 2023, and holds a valid
golf cart business license for 2024, shall be issued no more golf cart vehicle
licenses per year pursuant to Section
858.01 than the number of golf cart licenses the person, firm or corporation
held during 2023.
   (c)   A person, firm or corporation to whom division (b) of this section
does not apply, shall be issued such number of golf cart vehicle licenses in
2024 as is approved by Council, not to exceed the number of golf carts the
person, firm, or corporation owned and had registered pursuant to Ohio R.C.
Chapter 4503 in 2023 and provided those golf cart vehicle licenses do not
exceed the total number of golf cart licenses permitted per calendar year in
division (a) above. An applicant for a golf cart business license subject to
this section shall bear the burden of proving the number of golf carts
registered pursuant to Ohio R.C. Chapter 4503 as required by division (c) by
providing copies of said registrations when submitting their application for a
golf cart business license pursuant to Section
858.05.
   (d)   Notwithstanding the nontransferable vehicle license limitation in
section
858.01(a), no person, firm, or corporation shall transfer a golf cart vehicle
registration license except:
      (1)   Subject to the approval of Council, a person, firm, or corporation
may apply to transfer a golf cart vehicle registration license to another
person, firm or corporation who holds a golf cart business license.
(Ord. 1430-24. Passed 3-12-24; Ord. 1440-24. Passed 5-14-24.)
858.99 PENALTY.
   (a)   Whoever violates Section
858.01(a) is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree and shall be fined
not more than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) or imprisoned not more than
30 days, or both. A separate offense shall be deemed committed for each rental
vehicle for which the vehicle license fee provided for in Section
858.01(a) remains unpaid and for each day in which said rental vehicle is
offered for rent or hire within the Village.
(Ord. 645-95. Passed 12-14-95.)
   (b)   Whoever violates Section
858.01(b) is guilty of a minor misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than one
hundred fifty dollars ($150.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed
for each rental vehicle for which the information required in Section
858.01(a) is not provided and for each day in which said rental vehicle is
offered for rent or hire within the Village.
   (c)   Whoever violates Section
858.01(d) is guilty of a minor misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than one
hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) for each separate offense. A separate offense
shall be deemed committed for each rental vehicle for which the required
vehicle fee paid document required in Section
858.01(d) is not exhibited and for each day in which said rental vehicle is
offered for rent or hire within the Village.
   (d)   Whoever violates Section
858.02 is guilty of a minor misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than one
hundred fifty dollars ($150.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed:
      (1)   For each day in which proper signage is not posted pursuant to
Section
858.02(e); and
      (2)   For each day and for each golf cart that fails to display proper
signage pursuant to Section
858.02(g) and (h).
   (e)   Whoever violates Section
858.03(a) is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree and shall be fined
not more than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) or imprisoned not more than
30 days, or both. A separate offense shall be deemed committed for each day in
which a person, firm, or corporation fails to obtain a required golf cart
business license.
   (f)   Whoever violates Section
858.03(b) is guilty of a minor misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than one
hundred fifty dollars ($150.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed
for each day and for each vehicle offered for rent or hire within the Village
for which a vehicle license does not exist under Section
858.01.
(Ord. 659-96. Passed 6-13-96; Ord. 1007-11. Passed 4-11-11; Ord. 1039-12.
Passed 5-14-12; Ord. 1289-21. Passed 11-9-21; Ord. 1430-2024. Passed 3-12-24;
Ord. 1450-2024. Passed 7-19- 24; Ord. 1482-25. Passed 4-8-25.)

866.01 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   The following words and phrases, when used in
Chapter 866, shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this
section:
      (1)   "Cab" shall mean taxicab.
      (2)   "Council" shall mean the Put-in-Bay Village Council.
      (3)   "Fiscal Officer" shall mean the Fiscal Officer of the Village, his
or her successors, or his or her designees.
      (4)   "License" shall mean an official document issued by the Village
Fiscal Officer authorizing operation of a licensed taxicab, or vehicle, on the
streets of the Village.
      (5)   "Mayor" shall mean the Mayor of the Village of Put-in-Bay, or the
acting Mayor of the Village, or his or her designee.
      (6)   "Permanently revoke" shall mean to render the holder of a license
ineligible to reapply for said license.
      (7)   "Revoke" shall mean to terminate all rights or privileges under a
license for a period not to exceed 90 days.
      (8)   "Taxicab," for purposes of this chapter, includes any vehicle that
seeks its business or part thereof on public streets or in quasi-public places,
and which is operated on the streets of the Village for the purpose of
transporting members of the general public under expectation of compensation or
reward in any form. A "taxicab" includes any motor vehicle used to carry at
least four, but not more than 14 passengers, either metered or unmetered, but
not operating on a fixed route. The maximum number of passengers that a taxicab
may carry is 14. For purposes of this chapter, vehicles which may be defined as
buses by the Bureau of Motor Vehicles, carrying not more than 14 passengers,
not operating on a fixed route, and not regulated by the Public Utility
Commission of the State of Ohio shall be defined as "taxicabs."
      (9)   "Taxicab driver" shall mean the person driving a taxicab.
      (10)   "Taxicab owner" shall mean every corporation, association, joint
stock association, person, firm or copartnership, their lessees, directors,
receivers, trustees, appointed by any court whatsoever, or the heirs,
executors, administrators, or personal representatives or assigns of any
deceased owner, owning, controlling, operating or managing any taxicab,
provided, however, that a taxicab driver, driving a taxicab pursuant to a
contract of employment or a lease arrangement with the holder of a license for
such taxicab shall not be deemed a "taxicab owner".
      (11)   "Suspend" shall mean to temporarily deprive a licensee of rights
or privileges under a license for a period not to exceed 90 days.
   (b)   All vehicles operated by any establishment for hire not specifically
excluded in Section
866.01(c) of this chapter comes within the parameters of this chapter and must
be licensed by the Village to ensure the safety of the traveling public.
   (c)   Excluded Vehicles. The following vehicles are specifically exempted
from
Chapter 866:
      (1)   "Church bus" shall be a vehicle licensed and registered by the
State of Ohio as a church bus;
      (2)   "Funeral vehicle" shall mean motor vehicles owned by a funeral
director and used exclusively for funeral services or motor vehicles for hire
while being used for funeral services. This does not prohibit a vehicle from
being used as a livery vehicle and a funeral vehicle, such vehicle when used as
a livery vehicle must be licensed in accordance with Village Code
Chapter 866;
      (3)   "Motor bus" shall mean a vehicle owned by a registered common
carrier and registered by the Public Utilities Commission of the State of Ohio
(PUCO), and being operated for the purpose of intrastate or interstate commerce
on regulated routes or schedules;
      (4)   Vehicles operated by day care facilities for its customers and
patrons at no cost to said customers and patrons;
      (5)   "Hotel and motel courtesy vehicles" shall mean luxury limousine,
specialized passenger motor vehicle, omnibus or similar vehicle operated by a
hotel or motel as a courtesy for its patrons or its employees at no cost to its
patrons or employees.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.02 POWERS OF THE MAYOR AND COUNCIL.
   The Mayor shall have the power and authority to.
   (a)   Adopt rules and regulations, governing the issuance of taxicab and
taxicab driver licenses, the inspection of vehicles for hire and their
appurtenances, or any other matter under his or her supervision and control, as
are reasonable and necessary and not inconsistent with
Chapter 866. A copy of all such rules and regulations shall be distributed to
licensed drivers and owners at the time of issuance or renewal of licenses.
   (b)   Subpoena witnesses and evidence, and to act upon, make findings upon,
and grant or deny taxicab and taxicab driver's licenses or to suspend or revoke
such licenses for violations of
Chapter 866 or any rule or regulation lawfully promulgated by the Mayor
pursuant to this chapter.
   (c)   Place on licensing probation a taxicab driver or taxicab owner.
   (d)   Charge any person, corporation, partnership, or any entity owning or
leasing a taxicab, and/or any person having, or required to have, a taxicab
drivers' license with a violation of this
Chapter 866.
   (e)   The Council shall, at least once a year, conduct a public hearing to
determine the total number of taxicabs which may be licensed within the Village
based on consideration of public convenience and necessity. The Council's
determination made pursuant to this section shall be based upon the following
factors:
      (1)   Public demand for taxicab service;
      (2)   Whether the public has been adequately served by existing permitted
taxicab service and other forms of mass transportation;
      (3)   The relationship of the total number of permits to the revenue of
the existing permit holders and the effect on the wages or compensation, hours,
or conditions of service of drivers of taxicabs;
      (4)   South Bass Island area population and statistics, including tourist
population;
      (5)   The effect on traffic congestion and the safety of existing
vehicular and pedestrian traffic;
      (6)   Such other factors as the Council finds to be relevant.
   The Council shall make its determination as to the total number of taxicabs
to be licensed by December 14 of each year.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.03 TAXICAB LICENSE REQUIRED FOR EACH CAB; EXPIRATION.
   (a)   No person, firm or corporation shall operate or cause to be operated a
taxicab or proffer the services of any vehicle as a taxicab in the Village
unless the owner of the vehicle has obtained a business license and, pursuant
to this chapter, a taxicab license from the Village for each vehicle prior to
operation, and such license is not under suspension or revocation.
   (b)   Every such taxicab license shall expire on April 15 the year after it
was issued.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.04 TAXICAB LICENSE APPLICATIONS.
   (a)   Each applicant for a taxicab license shall present and file with the
Fiscal Officer his or her signed application, Form T-1, setting forth:
      (1)   The name and address of the applicant;
      (2)   The trade name under which he or she does business;
      (3)   The model, make, year and wheelbase of the vehicle for which the
license is desired;
      (4)   The seating capacity, which shall be determined by the number of
manufacturer-installed seatbelts;
      (5)   The design, color scheme and lettering, and marks proposed to be on
such vehicles (see Section
866.34);
      (6)   Any other information required by the Fiscal Officer pertinent to
the issuance of a taxicab license.
   (b)   The applicant shall further furnish:
      (1)   A copy of the certificate of title, or memorandum of title, of the
vehicle to be operated.
      (2)   The name and copy of a valid operator's license of each person who
will operate said vehicle, and, if a driver is hired subsequent to the issuance
of the taxicab permit, the applicant shall provide the Fiscal Officer, in
writing, with the name and copy of a valid operator's license of said person.
If a vehicle is operated as a taxicab within the Village by a driver whose name
and driving record are not on file as provided for herein, or if said driver is
in violation of Section
866.27, the Council may revoke or suspend the business license of the company
or person pursuant to Section
802.11, or the taxicab license for the vehicle being so operated, pursuant to
Section
866.14.
      (3)   A policy or policies of liability insurance issued for the duration
of the taxicab permit applied for or longer, by a responsible insurance
company, licensed to do business in Ohio, approved as to the reasonable
sufficiency by the Mayor or his or her designee, which policy or policies shall
provide indemnity for the protection to the applicant, and naming the Village
as additional insured, against loss resulting from the operation of each
taxicab for which a taxicab permit shall be issued, in the amount of one
million dollars ($1,000,000) for injury or death of any one person in any one
accident. The said policy shall also contain underinsured/uninsured motorist
coverage and a medical payment provision of at least five thousand dollars
($5,000). The applicant shall file with the Fiscal Officer a certificate of
insurance showing said coverage. All insurance policies shall also contain a
provision to notify the Village if the insurance is canceled.
      (4)   A copy of the Village business license, obtained in accordance with
Section
802.02 of these Codified Ordinances.
      (5)   A fee of two hundred dollars ($200.00) per taxicab.
      (6)   Proof that each motor vehicle to be used as a taxicab passed an
inspection by the State Highway Patrol, arranged by the owners and obtained at
the owners' own expense. The vehicle inspection shall verify that the vehicle
has all of the safety equipment required by law and that the same is in safe
and proper working order. Each vehicle used as a taxicab shall display a valid
safety inspection sticker obtained as a result of the inspection by the Ohio
State Patrol.
      (7)   A telephone number where taxicab service can be obtained 24 hours a
day, seven days a week, from the Friday before Memorial Day through Labor Day.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.05 ISSUANCE OF LICENSE.
   (a)   The Fiscal Officer may receive taxicab license applications whenever
taxicab licenses are available for purchase. The Mayor, or his or her designee,
shall issue such taxicab licenses as are necessary to cover the applicants who
have applied for taxicab licenses under this chapter, and who have conformed to
the requirements of this chapter, unless the Council of the Village, by
resolution, shall limit the number of taxicab licenses which can be issued,
based upon the health, welfare, and safety of the public in the Village, or as
provided in Sections
866.36 and
866.37.
   (b)   Taxicab licenses, if available for purchase, shall be issued to such
eligible applicants upon completion of the following:
      (1)   Payment of the proper license fee pursuant to Section
866.07;
      (2)   Furnishing to the Fiscal Officer information covering the
particular vehicle to be licensed, as provided in Section
866.04, including State license number, the motor and serial numbers thereof,
the name and address of the person from whom the vehicle was purchased or
leased, together with a copy of the certificate of title, or memorandum
certificate of title and any other information required by the Fiscal Officer;
      (3)   Furnishing to the Fiscal Officer evidence of liability protection
as required in Section
866.17; and
      (4)   Certification by the taxicab owner under Section
866.15 that the vehicle to be licensed has been inspected and that it complies
with all pertinent safety regulations. The vehicle must be in a thoroughly safe
condition for the transportation of passengers, clean, fit, of good appearance
and well painted and lettered.
   (c)   After a taxicab successfully completes the inspection, a windshield
decal shall be issued by the Fiscal Officer and shall be affixed to the
windshield in the lower right corner of the windshield. The sticker shall
clearly indicate that the vehicle has received and satisfied the inspection.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.06 TAXICAB LICENSE ISSUANCE; DISPLAY.
   (a)   After the investigation of the application, if the Mayor or his or her
designee decides it to be necessary, the Council shall hold a hearing on the
application for a taxicab license. If the Council finds, upon investigation and
hearing, that the health, welfare, and safety of the public in the Village do
not justify the operation of the vehicle for the taxicab license desired, the
Council shall forthwith notify the applicants of its findings. If Council
finds, upon such investigation and hearing, that the health, welfare, and
safety of the public in the Village do justify the operation of the vehicle or
vehicles for the license desired, Council shall forthwith notify the applicant.
   (b)   The taxicab license shall be prominently displayed on the front
windshield of the passenger side of each taxicab at all times.
   (c)   A photocopy of the driver's license of the driver of the taxicab shall
be posted in a conspicuous location in the taxicab with personal information
redacted.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.07 TAXICAB LICENSE FEES.
   The annual taxicab license fee shall be two hundred dollars ($200.00) per
cab, payable in advance, shall be non-refundable, and shall be in addition to
any fee required under the laws of the State on all motor vehicles.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.08 TAXICAB LICENSE RENEWAL; TRANSFER
   All owners of a taxicab license, at the completion of the year after which
the taxicab license was issued, shall reapply and follow the procedures
required in this
Chapter 866, and all other requirements of the Business Regulation Code.
Business licenses and taxicab licenses shall not be transferable.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.09 TRANSFER OF LICENSE TO OTHER VEHICLE.
   In the event the owner of a licensed taxicab shall cease to own the same, or
in the event that such vehicle shall become unsuitable for operation, an
affidavit to such effect may be filed with the Fiscal Officer. The Fiscal
Officer shall, upon approval, transfer the license to any other vehicle
belonging to such owner, provided that such vehicle passes the inspection
required by Section
866.15, and complies with applicable Village Code provisions specifying taxicab
requirements, and the payment of a processing fee of one hundred dollars
($100.00). This provision applies to the owner of two or more vehicles only
where the vehicle maintains the same color, name, and number as the vehicle it
is replacing.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.10 TRANSFER OF LICENSE TO OTHER OWNER.
   No taxicab license shall be transferred from one owner to another.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.11 RECORDS; TRIP SHEETS.
   (a)   The owner or the person in charge of one or more taxicabs shall keep a
record of all such taxicabs showing the body number, the Village license
number, and such data as may be necessary to identify the driver of such
vehicle at any and all times.
   (b)   All such records shall be maintained and not destroyed for a period of
six months, and shall be subject to inspection at all times by the Chief of
Police and by the Fiscal Officer.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.12 SERVICE TO BE RENDERED ON DEMAND.
   It shall be the duty of every driver of an unengaged taxicab, upon request,
to transport any orderly person between any two points on South Bass Island, so
long as the destination is accessible on suitable roads. A driver shall not
have a duty to transport persons if the cab is previously engaged to full
capacity, transportation of such person shall substantially delay other
passengers, or if the driver reasonably determines the prospective passenger(s)
has no ability to pay or is under suspicious circumstances. Should it be shown
at any time to the satisfaction of the Council that a driver has failed to
comply with the requirements of this section, the Council may, after hearing,
suspend or revoke the owner's business license pursuant to Section
802.11, or the taxicab license pursuant to Section
866.14.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.13 DISPLAYING RATES; EXCESSIVE CHARGES.
   (a)   Every taxicab shall, at all times, display the following:
      (1)   The price of the fare per person clearly marked in letters no
smaller than two inches high, clearly visible to the public. The marking must
read "$_____ per person". The price per person is at the discretion of the
taxicab company.
      (2)   The name and telephone number of the taxicab company clearly marked
on each side of the taxicab in lettering no smaller than two inches and be
clearly visible to the public.
   (b)   Each taxicab must be inspected by the Ohio State Patrol each year and
shall, after June 15, 2004, display a valid Safety Inspection Sticker issued by
the Ohio State Patrol. It is the responsibility of the taxicab permit holder to
arrange and complete this inspection.
   (c)   No vehicle operated as a taxicab shall exceed the width of 80 inches,
excluding mirrors, or shall exceed the length of 25 feet.
   (d)   It shall be unlawful for the owner of a taxicab, or for any other
person having possession or control of a taxicab, to operate a taxicab upon the
streets after June 15, 2004, unless the vehicle has insurance on the vehicle
required by Section 886.04(b)(3).
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.14 GROUNDS FOR PERMANENT REVOCATION, REVOCATION AND SUSPENSION OF TAXICAB
OWNERS' LICENSE.
   (a)   The Council may, after notice and a public hearing, revoke or suspend
by a vote of the majority of Council the license for any licensed taxicab for
any length of time, for the following acts or omissions by the taxicab owner:
      (1)   A taxicab company has violated or is violating this chapter.
      (2)   A taxicab company has repeat violations of State or local laws or
ordinances. "Repeat" violations shall entail three or more violations of
traffic or other laws in a 30-day period for taxicab companies that have three
or less cabs, or five or more violations for taxicab companies that have four
or more cabs.
      (3)   There is a false statement made in the application for license.
      (4)   Refusing trip service on demand to any orderly person for lawful
purposes when in service and available.
      (5)   Failing to maintain the operator records sheets required by Section
866.11.
      (6)   Permitting the operation of a taxicab for hire by any person who is
not licensed as provided in
Chapter 866.
      (7)   Knowingly permitting the operation of a taxicab for hire by any
person who is not suitably dressed, wearing a taxicab company uniform shirt
with the name of the taxi company printed on the shirt, neat in appearance, and
clean of person.
      (8)   Knowingly permit the operation of a taxicab which displays the
emblem of a credit card program or a discount program when the taxicab owner
does not participate in which program.
      (9)   Failing to appear before the Council when properly notified to do
so.
      (10)   Verbally threaten or attempt to intimidate any employee of the
Village for actions taken in the enforcement of the provisions of this
Chapter 866 of the Village Code.
      (11)   Any other form of misconduct, which shall mean conduct apart from
the generally accepted practices of taxicab owners, which demonstrates
personal, corporate, managerial, ethical or professional characteristics or
disposition rendering a person unsuitable to owning a taxicab.
   The Council shall revoke an owner's license if it appears upon investigation
and hearing by the Council that said license has been obtained by willful
misrepresentation.
   (b)   The Village Council or the Mayor may call a special meeting of the
Council to determine if a revocation or suspension of the business license or
taxicab license is warranted. The owner of the business license and/or the
taxicab license shall be given notice of the date, time and place of the
meeting by personal service or by regular United States mail, sent to the
address listed in the Village application form T-1 submitted to obtain the
taxicab license.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.15 INSPECTIONS.
   (a)   The Mayor, or his or her designee, shall establish the criteria and
the procedure for a reasonable inspection of a proposed taxicab to be performed
prior to initial licensing and prior to any renewal of a taxicab license.
      (1)   The Mayor shall designate one or more commercial automobile service
establishments whose ownership and management do not have ownership and
management responsibilities for any taxicabs within the corporate limits of the
Village to perform such inspections. The reasonable cost of such inspection
shall be paid by the owner of such vehicle at the time of inspection.
      (2)   The inspecting establishment shall provide a copy of the report to
the operator of the taxicab. This report shall be taken to the Fiscal Officer
prior to the issuance or renewal of the license for that vehicle, pursuant to
Section
866.05.
      (3)   All criteria must be satisfactory prior to the approval of
licensing. If any portion of the inspection is unsatisfactory, the taxicab
owner shall cause the condition to be corrected and shall have the vehicle
reinspected at the designated location.
   (b)   The Mayor shall make or cause to be made additional inspections of
taxicabs at least once during the 12-month period after initial licensure, or
at any other time at the discretion of the Mayor.
      (1)   If, upon any inspection, a taxicab is found to be unsafe, unclean
or unsightly, the Fiscal Officer or law enforcement officer may remove the
inspection decals and direct that the vehicle be taken out of service until
made safe, clean and presenting a neat appearance. Such taxicabs taken out of
service must be reinspected and approved by the Fiscal Officer before being
returned to service. After completion of such requirements and the payment of a
service fee of ten dollars ($10.00), a new decal shall be affixed.
      (2)   The Fiscal Officer shall cause a memorandum of such inspection
failure to be recorded on the record of the owner of said taxicab.
   (c)   After a taxicab successfully completes the inspection, a windshield
decal shall be issued by the Fiscal Officer and shall be affixed to the
windshield in the lower right corner of the windshield. The sticker shall
clearly indicate that the vehicle has received and satisfied the inspection.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.16 TAXICAB VEHICLE STANDARDS; PERMITTING OPERATION OF AN UNSAFE VEHICLE.
   (a)   No person shall knowingly permit the operation of a taxicab unless it
is equipped with the following:
      (1)   A light within the passenger compartment;
      (2)   Two-way radio or telephone service; this service shall be listed in
the telephone directory assistance listings by the business name of the
taxicab. It will have the capability of vehicle to base and base to vehicle
communications to a person or company in a business relationship to the owner
as a radio. Any system, whether or not such radio includes a base unit, should
be capable of communication with a non-mobile telephone or being activated by
any non-mobile telephone. All radios used in taxicabs shall be registered with
the Police Department. A reasonable time for repair of the radio will be
allowed provided the Fiscal Officer is notified as soon as practicable upon the
determination by the owner or driver that the radio is not properly
functioning. In no case shall this period of time be in excess of ten days
without the approval of the Mayor.
      (3)   Safety or shatterproof glass in all windshields and windows;
      (4)   Passenger restraints such as manufacturer-installed seat belts or
air bags, which may be used at the option of the passenger, numbering no fewer
than the maximum occupancy of the cab;
      (5)   A suitable holder for the driver's identification card in a place
where such card will be visible to the passengers at all times.
   (b)   No person shall knowingly permit the operation of any taxicab which is
in such unsafe condition as to endanger any person or property.
   (c)   No person shall place any vehicle into service as a taxicab which does
not have at least three doors. No vehicle which requires the movement of a seat
or any portion of a seat to gain access to other seating shall be placed into
service as a taxicab.
   (d)   No person shall allow the operation of any taxicab which does not
comply with the standards established in Section
866.15.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.17 LIABILITY PROTECTION REQUIRED.
   No license to operate any taxicab shall be issued or renewed by the Mayor
and it shall be unlawful to operate or permit the operation of any such
taxicab, unless and until the owner of same shall deposit and maintain on
deposit with the Fiscal Officer, subject to the approval of the Council,
evidence of liability protection the limit of which shall not be less than one
million dollars ($1,000,000) for liability imposed by law for damages on
account of bodily injuries, death or property damages (other than injuries,
death or property damages of the owner or taxicab driver) in any one accident
resulting from the ownership, maintenance or use of each such taxicab.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.18 EVIDENCE OF LIABILITY PROTECTION.
   Evidence of liability protection as required under Section
866.17 may be given by filing a policy of insurance as provided in Section
866.19.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.19 INSURANCE.
   Evidence of liability protection shall be furnished by filing with the
Fiscal Officer a policy of insurance in the amount of not less than one million
dollars ($1,000,000), known as combined single limit insurance coverage, issued
by an insurance company duly licensed to transact such business in the State of
Ohio, insuring the owner of such taxicab and also any person operating the same
in the Village as a taxicab and agreeing to pay any judgment creditor, to the
extent specified in such policy, any final judgment rendered against the
insured or such operator by reason of such liability as provided in Section
866.18.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.20 INSURANCE CANCELLATION.
   (a)   The insurance policy as provided in Section
866.19 must provide for cancellation by the insurer upon written notice to the
Village Fiscal Officer, but this provision shall not be construed to waive any
lawful notice which the insurer must give to the insured.
   (b)   The owner or his or her designee shall provide notice of cancellation
of insurance to the Fiscal Officer at least seven days prior to the day of
insurance cancellation, and at the time of cancellation voluntarily surrender
the taxicab owner license and safety decal for which the cancellation is
effective. If the license is voluntarily surrendered, the Mayor may, upon the
filing of proof of insurance required by Section
866.17, and its approval by the Village Attorney, reinstate such permit.
   (c)   If an owner shall fail to comply with the requirements of division
(b), prior to the Fiscal Officer receiving notice from the insurer of such
cancellation, the Fiscal Officer shall immediately suspend the taxicab license
of any vehicle covered by said policy. If proof of insurance is given prior to
the effective date of the suspension, the suspension can be waived by the
Fiscal Officer.
   (d)   Upon the effective date of the suspension, the owner must surrender
the license and decal for each vehicle not covered by an insurance policy. The
Mayor may, upon the filing of proof of insurance required by Section
866.17, its approval by the Village Attorney, the reinspection of each vehicle
covered by the policy, and the payment of the fee required by Section
866.09, reinstate such license.
   (e)   The owner shall notify the Fiscal Officer within five days of the
removal of a licensed taxicab driver from the taxicab owner's insurance
coverage by its insurer.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.21 APPROVAL BY VILLAGE ATTORNEY.
   Any liability protection obtained by an owner pursuant to Section
866.18 in the form of an insurance policy, shall be subject to the approval of
the Village Attorney as to its compliance with this chapter and as to its form
and legality.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.22 ANNUAL STATEMENT OF CLAIMS AND JUDGMENTS.
   Every licensee shall furnish to the Fiscal Officer not later than December 1
of each year a full and complete statement of claims filed and judgments
rendered against such licensee arising out of the operation of the taxicabs,
which statement shall be in such form as the Fiscal Officer prescribes.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.23 NONPAYMENT OF JUDGMENT.
   In the event of recovery of any final judgment and termination of final
appeal proceedings, if any, against the owner of any taxicab, for damages on
account of bodily injuries or death or for damage to property (other than
injuries, death or property damage of the owner or taxicab driver) resulting
from such ownership, maintenance or use of such taxicab in the Village, and
nonpayment thereof for a period of 30 days thereafter, the Council shall
forthwith revoke all taxicab licenses of such taxicab owner.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.24 TAXICAB DRIVERS' CERTIFICATION CARD.
   (a)   Application for Certification Card.
      (1)   Every person driving a taxicab having a taxicab license from the
Village must obtain a taxicab driver's certification card from the Village.
Every applicant for a certification card as a driver of a taxicab shall make an
application to the Mayor, or his or her designee, on forms provided by the
Village and shall set forth in the application that the applicant is:
         A.   A citizen of the United States or a legal alien;
         B.   Able to speak, read and write the English language;
         C.   Twenty-one years of age or over;
         D.   Free of defective or uncorrected vision, defective or uncorrected
hearing, epilepsy, vertigo, heart trouble and any other infirmity, physical or
mental, which, in the opinion of the Mayor or his or her designee, may render
him or her unfit for the safe operation of the taxicab;
         E.   Not addicted to the use of alcohol or drugs;
         F.   In possession of a valid motor vehicle operator's license issued
by the State of Ohio, or a valid CDL operator's license duly issued according
to law by any other state;
         G.   Written proof the applicant is covered with motor vehicle
liability insurance by the insurance carrier for the person or the company
holding a taxicab license;
         H.   A BCI & I and FBI criminal history check must be submitted and
mailed directly to the Village from BCI; subsequent BCI & I and FBI criminal
history check must be submitted annually by each taxicab driver to the Mayor,
or his or her designee, by mail directly from BCI; and
         I.   The application will be investigated for accuracy by the Police
Department and will include a local records check.
      (2)   The applicant shall also furnish any other information required by
the Mayor or his or her designee.
      (3)   Every driver of a taxicab, with the submission of the application,
shall pay to the Village a fee of fifty dollars ($50.00).
      (4)   Each applicant for a certification card under the provisions of
this section shall file with his application two acceptable, close up color
photographs, each one and one-half inches by one and one half inches, which
shall have been taken within 60 days next preceding the date of application.
      Applications shall be sworn to by the applicant. Each application shall
be on file with the Fiscal Officer.
   (b)   Examination of Applicant.
      (1)   After complying with all the requirements of this chapter, every
applicant may be examined by the Mayor, or his or her designee, as to the
applicant's knowledge of the provisions governing the operation of a vehicle
for hire, and as to the applicant's knowledge of the Village and the traffic
regulations. The applicant shall produce evidence that he or she has had at
least six months experience in operating a motor vehicle, and shall, if
required, demonstrate his or her skill and ability.
      (2)   Every applicant may be examined by the Mayor, or his or her
designee, particularly as to the applicant's criminal record, if any, and
especially as to whether or not the applicant has been convicted of a felony at
any time.
   (c)   Issuance of License.
      (1)   If the Mayor, or his or her designee, is satisfied that the
applicant, under the provisions of this chapter, is a suitable and proper
person to drive a vehicle for hire and the applicant's examination discloses no
matter which, in the opinion of the Mayor, should be called to the attention of
the Council, then the Mayor shall have the authority to issue the license.
      (2)   It shall be within the discretion of the Mayor or his or her
designee to refer his or her findings to the Council, which shall then
investigate and hold a hearing as to such application for a license. The
applicant shall be notified of the Council's findings.
      (3)   No license shall be issued to any applicant that has been convicted
of the following offenses within the last five years:
         A.   Manslaughter or homicide of any degree resulting from the
operation of a motor vehicle;
         B.   Driving a motor vehicle while under the influence of intoxicating
liquor or drugs;
         C.   Any felony in which physical violence is used; or
         D.   Any State offense described below or its equivalent in a Village
code;
            1.   Rape;
            2.   Sexual battery;
            3.   Corruption of a minor;
            4.   Gross sexual imposition; or
            5.   Sexual imposition.
      (4)   A.   The Council shall review the application of any of the
following persons prior to issuance:
            1.   Any person on probation or parole for a felony or aggravated
felony at the time of application;
            2.   Any person convicted for the use or concealment of a weapon;
            3.   Any person released from a correctional facility within 12
months of the date of the application; and
            4.   Any person convicted of two or more offenses relating to the
illegal use or possession of drugs.
         B.   The Council may require additional information or a personal
appearance by the applicant or both.
      (5)   Any applicant who has accumulated eight or more points on his or
her Ohio driver's license within the two-year period preceding the date of
application shall not be issued a license.
      (6)   Nothing in this section shall be construed to limit the discretion
of the Mayor, or his or her designee, regardless of time limit stated, to
refuse to issue a license for these or other background related issues.
   (d)   At the time of the issuance of a taxicab driver’s certification card
it shall include a photo identification card, the specifications of which shall
be designed by the Village Administrator.
   (e)   Taxicab driver's certification cards issued pursuant to this chapter
shall expire on May 13 of each year.
   (f)   No person shall drive a taxicab for hire before a driver's
certification card is issued to the driver, and the card is displayed in the
taxicab.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10; Ord. 1019-11. Passed 4-11-11.)
866.25 SUSPENSION BY MAYOR.
   (a)   When, in the discretion of the Mayor, a taxicab driver presents an
immediate danger to the health, safety, or welfare of the citizens of the
Village, the Mayor may immediately suspend the license of such person.
   (b)   When a driver is notified of such suspension, he or she shall
surrender his license and identification card to the Mayor, the Fiscal Officer,
or the Chief of Police.
   (c)   Pending a decision by the Mayor, the Fiscal Officer may impose a
temporary suspension for a period not to exceed 24 hours. This temporary
suspension shall not be extended by the Fiscal Officer.
   (d)   A driver shall have the right of appeal to the Council of any such
suspension. A hearing will be held within five working days from the date of
receipt of the written request for a hearing.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.26 RE-APPLICATIONS.
   (a)   When an applicant has been denied a license by the Mayor, or an
applicant's license has been revoked, no new application shall be considered
for a period of three months; except that whenever such license was revoked for
driving a vehicle during a period for which his or her license has been
suspended, as provided in Section
866.25, the driver shall not be eligible to receive a new license for a period
of one year from the date of revocation.
   (b)   This section shall not apply in cases of permanent revocation.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.27 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall drive or operate a taxicab within the corporate limits,
unless he or she is duly licensed as provided in this chapter, except the
operators of vehicles for hire who are not licensed by the Village may bring
passengers into the corporate limits, but may not pick up any passengers within
the corporate limits of the Village for any destination.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.28 DRIVING WHILE LICENSE SUSPENDED.
   Whenever a licensed taxicab driver is convicted of driving a vehicle, for
which an Ohio driver's license is required, during a period for which such
license has been suspended or revoked, it shall be mandatory upon the Mayor,
upon being notified of such conviction, to notify the Council, which shall
revoke the taxicab driver's license of such driver.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.29 DRIVER STANDARDS.
   (a)   Any Village police officer shall have the power to inspect a driver
upon any complaint or for any other reason.
      (1)   If, upon any inspection, a driver is found to be unclean or
unsuitably dressed as defined in the regulations adopted by the Mayor, the
police officer shall impound the identification card of such driver until he or
she has corrected the condition.
      (2)   If the driver desires to contest the action of the police officer,
the driver must inform the police officer immediately. A formal complaint will
then be filed by the police officer who will present the complaint at the next
meeting of Council. Such a request by the driver shall be deemed a waiver of
the ten-day notice requirement. Any driver who requests a formal review shall
be allowed to retain his or her identification card and the right to drive
pending Council action.
   (b)   No person shall operate or be in physical control of a taxicab while
under the influence of alcohol or any drug of abuse.
      (1)   A police officer, upon probable cause, may order any driver
operating a taxicab or in physical control of a taxicab, to submit to a
chemical test or a test of breath or urine for the purpose of detecting the
alcoholic content of his or her blood or the presence of illegal drugs. The
officer shall designate the test to be used.
      (2)   The test given under this provision of the Village code should not
be used in a prosecution for any criminal or traffic offense and shall not
require the arrest of the driver.
      (3)   The refusal to submit to the test shall be referred to the Council
for action and may be grounds for the suspension of the license of the person
refusing the test.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.30 GROUNDS FOR PERMANENT REVOCATION, REVOCATION AND SUSPENSION OF A TAXICAB
DRIVERS LICENSE.
   The Council may, after notice and hearing, revoke or suspend the license of
any licensed taxicab driver for any of the following reasons:
   (a)   Licensee obtained a license by a false statement in his or her
application, or upon misrepresentation or upon false statements in his or her
affidavit in applying for a duplicate license or identification card.
   (b)   Licensee has become physically or mentally incapable of driving a
vehicle for hire.
   (c)   Licensee has been convicted of a crime involving moral turpitude.
   (d)   The driver has been guilty of misconduct, which shall include, but not
be limited to:
      (1)   Failing to report within 24 hours to the appropriate law
enforcement agency any accident in which the licensee is involved, which
involves damages in excess of three hundred dollars ($300.00).
      (2)   The possession or use of any controlled substance, as defined in
Ohio R.C. 3719.01 not specifically prescribed for him by a physician, while in
a vehicle for hire or possessing any open alcoholic beverage container in a
vehicle for hire.
      (3)   Being in control of or operating any vehicle while under the
influence of alcohol or drugs.
      (4)   Gambling or being in a taxicab where gambling is occurring
regardless of whether the operator receives a percentage of the proceeds or
not.
      (5)   Refusing trip service on demand to any orderly person for lawful
purposes, unless the demand is by radio dispatch service or unless such taxicab
is previously engaged.
      (6)   Permitting a non-fare paying passenger to occupy a taxicab, while
engaged in business or seeking business, but shall not apply to company or
Village officials riding in such vehicle on official business.
      (7)   Failing to display an identification card issued to the driver in a
place visible at all times to the occupants of the cab, or upon demand to the
occupants of a livery, failing to preserve such card in good order and
condition, or displaying an expired identification card.
      (8)   Operating a taxi which is unclean, or unsightly. If, upon
inspection under Section
866.16(a), taxicab is found to be in violation of this section, the Mayor or
his or her designee shall, in addition to any action taken against the license
of the vehicle, cause a memorandum of the inspection failure to be placed on
the record of the driver. Subsequent offenses or extreme situations shall be
brought before the Council.
      (9)   Operating a taxicab while unclean or unsuitably dressed. All
taxicab drivers must be clean and suitably dressed while operating a taxicab,
and must be wearing a taxicab company uniform shirt with the name of the taxi
company clearly printed on the shirt. Any reprimand for this section shall be
recorded on the permanent record of the driver. Subsequent offenses or extreme
situations, or appeals of a police officer's determination under this section
or Section
866.29 shall be brought before the Council.
      (10)   Any accumulation of 12 or more points within a two-year period on
the operator's license of the driver. This shall apply whether any number of
such points were accumulated before the granting of a taxicab operator's
license or while operating a taxicab.
      (11)   Any violation enumerated in Section
866.24(d)(3), or the commission of any crime which demonstrates personal
characteristics rendering a person unsuitable to drive a taxicab.
      (12)   A violation of Section
866.29(b), or may suspend only for a violation of Section
866.29(b)(3).
      (13)   Driving a taxicab while wearing earphones or headsets over the
ears or with a television operating in the vehicle.
      (14)   Driving a taxicab while having the driver's personal pet in the
taxicab.
      (15)   Failing to appear before the council when properly notified to do
so.
      (16)   Any other form of misconduct which shall mean conduct apart from
the generally accepted practices of taxicab drivers which demonstrates personal
characteristics rendering a person unsuitable to operate a vehicle for hire.
      (17)   Engage in disruptive behavior or misconduct at a meeting of the
Council, which shall mean behavior and conduct that prevents or disrupts an
orderly meeting. This includes but is not limited to the use of profanity,
yelling or screaming, preventing a recognized speaker from speaking, and
failing to follow the rulings of the chairperson.
      (18)   Verbally threaten or attempt to intimidate any employee of the
Village for actions taken in the enforcement of the provisions of this
Chapter 866.
   (e)   The Village Council or the Mayor may call a special meeting of the
Council to determine if a revocation or suspension of a taxicab drivers license
is warranted. The holder of the taxicab driver's license shall be given notice
of the date, time and place of the meeting by personal service or by regular
United States mail, sent to the address listed in the Village application to
obtain the taxicab drivers license. A vote of the majority of Council shall be
needed to suspend or revoke the license.
   (f)   This section shall not affect the operation and authority of the Mayor
and the Fiscal Officer to immediately suspend a taxicab drivers license under
the provisions of Section
866.25.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.31 DEFACING LICENSE, IDENTIFICATION CARD, RATE CARD; ASSIGNMENT.
   (a)   No licensed taxicab driver shall knowingly deface any license or
identification card. In case of any violation of this provision, the Council
shall revoke the driver's license and such revocation shall be in addition to
any other penalty imposed.
   (b)   No license or identification card issued to any person under the
provision of this chapter shall be assigned or transferred.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.32 OPERATING AN UNLICENSED VEHICLE.
   (a)   No person shall operate any taxicab or vehicle for the purpose of
carrying the public generally as passengers for hire, gift, donation, or other
consideration, whether such consideration is paid direct or is a portion of
other services rendered or to be rendered for compensation, nor shall such
person solicit passengers unless:
      (1)   The owner of such vehicle has obtained a Village license for the
type and class of operation intended prior to the operation and such license is
not under suspension or revocation.
      (2)   The decal issued by the Village to evidence such licensing is
displayed.
   (b)   These provisions shall not apply to vehicles described in Section
866.01(c) nor to private vehicles used for the convenience of the owner or
operator and not for compensation, or to an operator who brought passengers
into the corporate limits and who does not pick up any passengers within the
corporate limits.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.33 RETURN OF LICENSE AND IDENTIFICATION CARD.
   (a)   Upon the Mayor's or the Fiscal Officer's suspension of a taxicab
driver's license that is not appealed to Council, or upon Council's suspension
or revocation of any taxicab driver's license, such driver shall return to the
Fiscal Officer the license and identification card theretofore issued to him;
provided that, in the event such items have been lost, the applicant shall file
an affidavit to that effect with the Fiscal Officer.
   (b)   Failure to file such affidavit or to return the license and
identification card shall be punishable according to Section
866.99.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.34 IDENTIFICATION OF TAXICABS.
   Every person owning or operating taxicabs under a license from the Village
may adopt any trade name, and shall adopt a uniform design, color scheme or
method of painting or lettering such taxicabs that is approved by the Mayor.
Such trade name, design, color scheme, or method of painting or lettering shall
include the following matter:
   (a)   An identification number assigned by the director to each taxicab,
shall be painted on each side and on the rear of the taxicab in letters not
less than four inches and not more than eight inches in height, and with each
line a minimum of one-half inch wide, which should be discernible from a
distance of 25 feet to a person of normal vision.
   (b)   The name of the owner, or the trade name under which he or she does
business, painted on each side and on the rear of the taxicab. The side letters
will not be less than four inches and not more than eight inches in height,
with each line a minimum of one-half inch wide.
   (c)   All mandatory lettering, identification numbers and wording, whether
in a particular trade name, design, color scheme, method of painting or
lettering or otherwise, as hereinbefore provided, shall be in the opinion of
the Mayor clearly identifiable, and shall be of such color as in the opinion of
the director will contrast distinctly with the color of the body of the
taxicab. Every identification number, word or letter required by this
Chapter 866 shall be applied with non-water-soluble paint, decals or adhesive-
backed lettering.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.35 UNAPPROVED TRADE NAMES OR DESIGNS.
   It shall be unlawful to cause or permit any taxicab to appear with a trade
name, design, color scheme or method of painting and lettering that is not
approved by the Mayor for the vehicle concerned or that is not in accordance
with the terms of this
Chapter 866. Additionally, no temporary markers or advertisements shall be
displayed on a taxicab window at any time.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.36 NUMBER OF TAXICAB LICENSES FIXED.
   (a)   It is hereby determined that 36 taxicab licenses issued to owners of
taxicabs is sufficient to serve adequately the need for taxi service in the
Village. Each public taxicab license shall be prominently displayed in the
vehicle.
   (b)   No owner or company shall be issued more than eight taxicab licenses.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10; Ord. 1117-15. Passed 7-13-15.)
866.37 LIMITATION ON NEW TAXICAB LICENSES.
   (a)   No license for the operation of taxicabs in excess of the limitation
prescribed by Section
866.36 shall be issued unless Council shall by resolution declare that public
convenience and necessity require the issuance of additional taxicab licenses
in the number set forth in such resolution. Upon the passage of such
resolution, approved by the Mayor, the Mayor shall be authorized to issue the
specified additional number of taxicab licenses.
   (b)   Before the adoption of such resolution, Council shall provide for
public hearings as may be necessary to determine whether public convenience and
necessity require the issuance of additional taxicab licenses, and the number
of any of such taxicab licenses which should be issued to meet such public
convenience and necessity. In determining whether public convenience and
necessity require the issuance of any additional licenses for taxicabs, Council
shall take into consideration:
      (1)   The number of taxicabs then licensed.
      (2)   Whether the requirements of public convenience and necessity can be
met and complied with only by the issuance of additional licenses.
      (3)   The resulting effect upon the business of existing licenses and
upon the existing agencies of mass transportation.
      (4)   The effect on traffic congestion and safety of the public using the
streets.
      (5)   The effect upon working conditions and wages or other compensation
paid to drivers of taxicabs of existing licensees.
      (6)   The financial responsibility of the applicant.
      (7)   Any other fact which Council may deem relevant.
   (c)   No finding of public convenience and necessity shall be required for
the issuance of licenses within the limitation of Section
866.36.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
866.99 PENALTIES.
   (a)   Whoever violates Section
866.03(a),
866.14(c),
866.16(a), (b), (c) or (d), or
866.32(a)(1) shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the first degree and shall be
fined not more than one thousand dollars ($1,000) or imprisoned not more than
six months, or both.
   (b)   Whoever violates Section
866.27,
866.32(a)(2) or
866.33 shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than
one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00). Upon subsequent conviction such person
shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree and shall be fined
not more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisoned for not more than 60
days, or both. Any violation shall constitute a separation offense for each
successive day continued.
   (c)   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any other provision of this
chapter is guilty of a minor misdemeanor for a first offense and shall be fined
mot more than one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00). For a second or subsequent
offense within one year, such person is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth
degree and shall be fined not more than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) or
imprisoned not more than 30 days, or both. A violation shall constitute a
separate offense for each successive day continued.
   (d)   A violation of any section of
Chapter 866 shall be grounds for the suspension, revocation or permanent
revocation of the taxicab owner's license or licenses, or in the case of a new
application shall be grounds to refuse to issue such license for a determinate
period of time, or permanently, as decided by Council.
   (e)   A violation of Sections
866.16,
866.27,
866.28,
866.29,
866.30, or
866.32 shall be grounds for the suspension or revocation of a taxicab driver's
license, or in the case of a new application, shall be grounds to refuse to
issue such license for a determinate period, or permanently, as decided by
Council.
(Ord. 973-09. Passed 4-12-10.)
CHAPTER 867
Pedicabs
867.01   Legislative findings.
867.02   Definitions.
867.03   Pedicab business license.
867.04   Issuance of pedicab business license.
867.05   Insurance.
867.06   Required equipment of pedicabs.
867.07   Inspection; pedicab registration plate.
867.08   Pedicab driver license.
867.09   Display of pedicab driver’s identification.
867.10   Restrictions on the operation of pedicabs.
867.11   Rates of pedicabs.
867.12   Denial of license or renewal, suspension and revocation.
867.13   Failure to display pedicab registration or pedicab driver's licence.
867.14   Enforcement.
867.99   Penalties.
867.01 LEGISLATIVE FINDINGS.
   It is the purpose of this chapter to regulate and control pedicab businesses
to protect consumers and to ensure the safety of the public, including
passengers and drivers operating pedicabs. It is the purpose of this chapter to
require the inspection of pedicabs to ensure that pedicabs are safely operated
in the streets of the Village, and to provide a process for their removal if
they have not been inspected as required.
(Ord. 1009-11. Passed 4-11-11.)
867.02 DEFINITIONS.
   Whenever used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Owned" or "owns" shall mean possession with good legal title, or
possession under a lease, reserve title contract, conditional sales agreement
or vendor's agreement or similar agreement.
   (b)   "Pedicab" shall mean a bicycle as defined in the traffic law or other
device that is designed and constructed to transport or carry passengers, that
is propelled by human power, and shall include commercial quadricycles.
   (c)   "Pedicab owner" or "owner" shall mean any person who owns one or more
pedicabs in the Village.
   (d)   "Pedicab business" or "business" shall mean a pedicab owner who
operates or authorizes the operation of one or more pedicabs in the Village.
   (e)   "Pedicab business license" shall mean a business license issued by the
Village pursuant to the provisions of this chapter and
Chapter 802 of the Village Ordinances.
   (f)   "Pedicab driver" shall mean any natural person who propels and
operates a pedicab in the Village of Put-in-Bay.
   (g)   "Pedicab driver license" shall mean a license issued by the Village to
a pedicab driver to operate a pedicab.
   (h)   "Person" shall mean any natural person, firm, partnership, joint
venture, corporation or association.
   (i)   "Commercial quadricycle" means a vehicle that has fully-operable
pedals for propulsion by human power and that meets all of the following
requirements:
      (1)   It has four wheels and is operated in a manner similar to a
bicycle.
      (2)   It has at least five seats for passengers.
      (3)   It is designed to be powered by pedaling of the operator and the
passengers.
      (4)   It is used for commercial purposes.
      (5)   It is operated by the vehicle owner or an employee of the owner.
(Ord. 1150-17. Passed 4-10-17.)
867.03 PEDICAB BUSINESS LICENSE.
   (a)   It shall be unlawful for a pedicab owner to conduct a pedicab business
picking up or dropping off passengers in the Village unless such pedicab owner
shall have first applied for and obtained from the Village a pedicab business
license pursuant to this chapter and
Chapter 802 of the Village Ordinances. An application for a pedicab business
license shall be made on such forms as prescribed by the Fiscal Officer.
   (b)   In order to obtain, or renew a pedicab business license, a pedicab
owner must provide the Village Fiscal Officer with the following:
      (1)   A list of all pedicabs owned, leased or controlled by such pedicab
owner for which such owner seeks registration pursuant to Section
867.07, and the seating capacity of the pedicab. Each such pedicab shall be
uniquely identified on such list;
      (2)   Proof that there is in force for the full license term a policy of
public liability and property damage insurance that meets the requirements of
Section
867.05 for each pedicab listed pursuant to division (b)(1) of this section; and
      (3)   A list of all persons who will be operating the permitted vehicle
and such other information as is required by Section
802.03 of the Village Ordinances to establish the pedicab owner's eligibility
for a pedicab business license under this chapter.
   (c)   A pedicab business license shall expire on April 15th of the year
after it is issued. The business license must be renewed annually as provided
in Section
802.02 of the Village Ordinances. The registration fee for each pedicab shall
be as prescribed in Section
858.01 of the Village Ordinances.
   (d)   Notwithstanding division (a) of this section, a person holding a
pedicab driver license shall not be required to obtain a pedicab business
license to drive a pedicab that is owned by a pedicab business licensed under
this chapter.
   (e)   No more than one pedicab business license shall be issued or renewed
per year.
(Ord. 1150-17. Passed 4-10-17; Ord. 1208-19. Passed 4-17-19.)
867.04 ISSUANCE OF PEDICAB BUSINESS LICENSE.
   (a)   A pedicab business license shall be issued only to a person who meets
all the requirements of this chapter and the provisions of
Chapter 802 of the Village Ordinances.
   (b)   A pedicab business license shall be valid only for the person in whose
name it is issued.
   (c)   The Fiscal Officer may refuse to issue to a pedicab owner a pedicab
business license or to renew a pedicab business license to a pedicab owner
based upon a determination that such applicant has engaged in conduct that
would constitute a basis for license suspension or revocation as set forth in
Section
867.12(a).
   (d)   As provided in Section
802.06 of the Village Ordinances a pedicab business license cannot be
transferred or sold.
(Ord. 1009-11. Passed 4-11-11.)
867.05 INSURANCE.
   (a)   It shall be unlawful for any pedicab business to operate or authorize
the operation of a pedicab within the Village unless there is in force for such
pedicab a policy of insurance that meets the requirements of this section.
   (b)   Such policy of liability insurance shall insure such pedicab business
and all pedicab drivers of the pedicabs of such business, whether such pedicab
drivers are employees of the pedicab business or operate such pedicabs
otherwise by agreement with the pedicab business. Such insurance policy must
provide, at minimum, the following protection:
      (1)   The pedicab business carries a policy providing liability coverage
for injury or death of any person or persons, and damage to or destruction of
any property in a combined single limit amount of one million dollars
($1,000,000), with a maximum of one million dollars ($1,000,000) for each
accident, where liability for such injury or death of a person or persons, or
damage to or destruction of property shall arise out of the operation of the
pedicab business's pedicabs; or
      (2)   Each pedicab is insured in at least the following amounts, where
liability for such injury or death of a person or persons, or damage to or
destruction of property shall arise out of the operation of the pedicab:
         A.   For personal injury or death to one person, one hundred thousand
dollars ($100,000);
         B.   For personal injury or death to all persons in one accident,
three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000), with a maximum of one hundred
thousand dollars ($100,000) for each person; and
         C.   For property damage, fifty thousand dollars ($50,000).
   (c)   Such policy of liability insurance shall name the Village as an
insured party.
   (d)   The pedicab business shall notify the Village Fiscal Officer of any
modification, amendment, cancellation or substitution of any insurance policy
required under division (b) of this section within 14 days of the date of the
notice to the pedicab business of such modification, amendment, cancellation or
substitution.
   (e)   If the policy of insurance required by this section lapses for any
reason, the license issued pursuant to Section
802.04 of the Village Ordinances shall become void for such pedicab business.
(Ord. 1009-11. Passed 4-11-11.)
867.06 REQUIRED EQUIPMENT OF PEDICABS.
   (a)   Each pedicab operated in the Village shall be equipped with the
following features:
      (1)   Three or more wheels;
      (2)   A unibody frame for the entire vehicle;
      (3)   Be equipped with seats for the operator and all passengers;
      (4)   Hydraulic or mechanical disc or drum brakes, which are unaffected
by rain or wet conditions, that enables the driver to bring the pedicab to a
controlled stop;
      (5)   A secondary or emergency brake system;
      (6)   Battery-operated headlights capable of projecting a beam of light
for a distance of 300 feet;
      (7)   Battery-operated taillights which are visible from 500 feet;
      (8)   Turn signal lights;
      (9)   Passenger seat belts;
      (10)   An audible signaling device;
      (11)   Reflectors on the spokes of the wheels of the pedicab and a
reflectorized slow moving vehicle emblem in conformance with R.C. § 4513.11(B)
or with alternative reflecting material visible to the rear pursuant to R.C. §
4513.11(F) as determined by the Chief of Police;
